newsitem.title: USA: Conn. jobless rate eases to 4.9 pct in February.
newsitem.headline: Conn. jobless rate eases to 4.9 pct in February.

text.p: Connecticut's unemployment rate fell three-tenths of a precentage point in February to 4.9 percent, signaling that the economy still is improving, the state Department of Labor said on Tuesday.
The rate stands nearly one percentage point below the year-ago level of 5.8 percent. January's level was revised.
"Connecticut's continued nonfarm job growth, and other positive indicators, give us evidence of a continuing recovery," said Salvatore DiPilo, labor statistics supervisor, in prepared remarks.

The manufacturing production workweek averaged 42.3 hours, off four-tenths of an hour, while average hourly earnings, at $14.22, rose one cent from January, and 37 cents over the year. But the average weekly wage of $601.51 was off $5.26 from January, though it rose a slim $11.50 over the year. These data were not seasonally adjusted.
The sectors that added gobs included government, up 2,200, services, 2,100, construction and mining, 700, manufacturing, 400, and transportation, communication, and utilities, 200.
However, there were declines in the wholesale and retail trade, which shed 900, and finance, insurance and real estate, down 400.
